definition: roof tile/abbr. for 瓦特[wa3 te4]

sentences.english: Rescuers worked after daybreak to try to reach those trapped in the rubble of collapsed buildings.
sentences.chinese: 救援人員拂曉開始搜尋被埋在倒坍建築物瓦礫中的人。

sentences.english: The rubble was moving. It was pressing down, slowly crushing them.
sentences.chinese: 瓦礫還在不斷地向下滾動，碾壓着他們的身體。

sentences.english: The result was further chaos on roads clogged by rubble and monsoon rains.
sentences.chinese: 結果由於瓦礫阻塞道路，季風帶來暴雨，混亂加劇。

sentences.english: I brushed the sand and debris from my knees and forearms.
sentences.chinese: 我拂去膝頭和前臂上的塵土和瓦礫。

sentences.english: After the bombing there was a lot of debris everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 轟炸之後到處瓦礫成堆。

sentences.english: Near the old Merchant Shipping Hall, a boy collects scraps in the rubble.
sentences.chinese: 在老商船會館附近，一個男孩正在瓦礫堆中拾荒。

sentences.english: Bodies were still being pulled from the rubble late Monday.
sentences.chinese: 截止週一，死屍仍不斷從瓦礫堆裏被扒出。

sentences.english: An unknown number of personnels are still trapped under the debris.
sentences.chinese: 據信還有數目不詳的人員被困在瓦礫下。

sentences.english: The rubble, Zhong Xiaoxian etc. People cant find the fuse, unable to detonate.
sentences.chinese: 碎石瓦礫中，鍾小嫺等人找不到導火索，無法引爆。

sentences.english: So there are people still living in tents, or in the rubble.
sentences.chinese: 就這樣，很多人還在帳篷或瓦礫裏生活。

sentences.english: Collapsed in a pile of rubble, an immature in the eyes of Xiaolian.
sentences.chinese: 在坍塌的瓦礫堆中，一張稚嫩的小臉出現在眼前。

sentences.english: Many people are entombed in the rubble of the bombe buildings.
sentences.chinese: 很多人被埋在被炸燬建築物的瓦礫堆。

sentences.english: When saving others must rescue in the building border rubble first survivor.
sentences.chinese: 救人時要先搶救建築物邊沿瓦礫中的倖存者。

sentences.english: The little town had been torn to pieces by the enemy's guns.
sentences.chinese: 這座小城被敵軍大炮炸成一片瓦礫。

sentences.english: Houses and stores have been reduced to empty shells. Piles of rubble line the streets.
sentences.chinese: 屋舍和店鋪都只剩下空殼，街上是成堆的瓦礫。

sentences.english: A small dresser of clothes survived, askew in the rubble of what used to be a bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 小櫃子的衣服存活，在過去是一間臥室瓦礫歪斜。

definition: grave/tomb/graveyard/cemetery/fig. one's native place (where one's ancestors are buried)
lit. windswept and battered by rain/to undergo hardship (idiom)
oxen and horses/beasts of burden/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
marble pillar (ornamental column in front of places, tombs)
